thread.title: Giants notes: Victor Cruz on practice field - Football
thread.title_full: Giants notes: Victor Cruz on practice field - Football - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: Giants notes: Victor Cruz on practice field - Football
text:
Cruz on field 
Victor Cruz (calf) was on the practice field Wednesday, and even though he didn’t participate, his presence again was a welcome sight and a promising sign for his return.
The wide receiver underwent an MRI to check on the progress he’s made since receiving a platelet-rich plasma (PRP) injection Oct. 1 to help quicken the healing of the strained left-calf injury that derailed his comeback from right-knee surgery in August.
There is optimism regarding Cruz’s progress, and he no longer has any pain in his calf.
Cruz stretched with the team and worked on the side during the portion of practice open to the media Wednesday, doing agility work with a member of the training staff.
Cruz likely will not be available for the Giants’ pivotal showdown with Dallas on Sunday at MetLife Stadium, but the following weekend against the Saints in New Orleans could be a realistic target. 
JPP visit on hold 
Jason Pierre-Paul is still expected to meet with the medical staff this week, but his visit has not happened yet.
Pierre-Paul met with the team Labor Day for the first and only time following the July 4 fireworks accident that cost him his right index finger and part of his right thumb. Pierre-Paul remains unsigned, and the Giants and his reps likely will have to negotiate a compromise on the price for his one-year deal. A contract must be signed by Nov. 17, or Pierre-Paul would be declared out for the season.
Beckham doesn’t practice 
WR Odell Beckham Jr. (hamstring) didn’t practice Wednesday, but the Giants likely will monitor his participation the way they did last week to make sure he’s ready to go Sunday. … LB Devon Kennard (hamstring) returned to practice as a limited participant. He said he expects to play against the Cowboys on Sunday after missing two games. "Two weeks felt like two months," he said. … The Giants signed CB Leon McFadden from the Arizona practice squad to fill the roster spot created by S Cooper Taylor’s release Tuesday. CBs Trumaine McBride (groin) and Trevin Wade (concussion) did not practice. 
— Art Stapleton
